reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup**

 *RDA*/ Velocity *Coil*/ 6 Wrap Single Fused Kanthal Clapton 2×26 core 32 wrap *W*/ 45 
*Wicking*/ Full Cotton *Ω*/0.26       
    
**Testing**        

*Steep Time*/3 weeks *% Used*/ 1.5     
*PG/VG* 50/50 *Nic%*/0    

**Mouth Feel** 

Heavy on the pallet and light on the nose, with a very light effervescence coming through.

**Throat Hit** 1/10       

**Flavor Properties** 

Very strong grape flavor, bright and pronounced, sweet and syrupy. And I feel as though I'm getting a light background Apple flavor.

**Relatable Flavors** 

Reminds me of my grandmother's homemade grape juice, with just a little extra fizz.             

**Off Flavors** 

Nothing really off here the syrupy aspect does leave a slight
aftertaste but not unpleasant, and there is no alcohol warmth coming from this flavor which I expected from the name.

**Position In The Recipe** 

Base, if you're looking to make a grape anything. Should work well as an accent brightening up other fruits along with adding sweetness, and when using with creams believe it will come out as a top note.

**Pairings** 

Fruits, berries, tropical fruits, and savory flavors.

**Notes**
In my opinion this is more of a grape flavoring.

   http://www.ecigexpress.com/diy-e-liquid/browse-flavorings/beverage-flavors/sparkling-wine-by-inawera-10ml.html

**Recipe**    

https://alltheflavors.com/recipes/6735

**Rating** 90/100            
                   
*Please if your opinion differs, or you have another review for this post it in the comments. Will help the master list
with multiple reviews in one spot.*
reviewsJson.author: Chrisdvr1
reviewsJson.title: Sparkling Wine
